reason: The argument that omega_1(nu_k) cannot equal infinity should be made explicit: if omega_1(nu_k) = infinity, then nG_p(omega_1(z)) -> nG_p(infinity) = 0 as z -> nu_k, contradicting nG_r(z) -> infinity. The current phrasing 'nG_p(w) diverges only when w -> lambda_j' handles this implicitly (infinity is not among the lambda_j), but stating this explicitly would strengthen the argument. The logical validity is not affected.
